channel.title: Connecting to Tableau on Dremio Modernization Workshop
channel.description: Recent content in Connecting to Tableau on Dremio Modernization Workshop

item.title: Signing up for a free trial of Tableau Online
item.description: Open a new tab in your browser and navigate to the following URL: https://sso.online.tableau.com/ From the Tableau Online Sign-up Screen, click “Sign-Up”. If you already have a Tableau account, feel free to use that account for this lab. After clicking sign-up, Tableau will ask if you would like to start a free trial. Click the Orange “Start Your Free Trial” Button. Enter your information to sign up for the Tableau free trial and press “Request Free Trial” Follow the on-screen instructions to verify your email with Tableau.

item.title: Connecting Tableau Online to Dremio
item.description: From the Tableau Home Screen click “Explore” found on the left side of the screen From the “New” Drop down click “Workbook” In your new workbook, you will immediately see a “Connect to Data” pop-up. From here you can connect to data already uploaded onto Tableau Online, files and data sources. For this lab, we are going to establish a connection to Dremio by clicking on “Connectors” From the connectors tab, select Dremio.

item.title: Connecting to your Dataset
item.description: Now that you have quickly connected Dremio to Tableau you can start to explore different tables without having to copy any of the data into Tableau. After a successful connection has been made Tableau will direct you to the “Data Source” tab in your new workbook. From the Data Connections tab in your Tableau workbook, select the following from the dropdown menus Under “Database”, select “DREMIO” Under “Schema”, enter the name of your Dremio Homespace (where you saved your VDS) Under Table, enter the name of the VDS (NYC_Taxi) that you saved in Dremio Your Tableau Inputs should look like this (IP Address & Schema name will be different) Drag the NYC_Taxi table from the left side under “Connections” to the center of the workbook where it says “Drag Tables Here” Now that you have connected Dremio to Tableau and selected the Table to analyze, you can now start creating visualizations.
